newsitem.title: GERMANY: German petrol tax hike would hurt carmakers - VDA.
newsitem.headline: German petrol tax hike would hurt carmakers - VDA.

text.p: The president of the VDA German automobile industry association Bernd Gottschalk said an increase in German petrol taxes would hurt German carmakers, a German newspaper reported on Saturday.

In a release ahead of publication on Sunday, Bild am Sonntag reported that Gottschalk said German drivers already felt overburdened by high taxes and that talk of further increases was bad for the economy.
Previous increases in petrol taxes had hurt car demand, he added.
Media reports have said Finance Minister Theo Waigel was considering rising petrol taxes to help plug a gaping budget hole.
